title: Lori Carson-Where it Goes
description:
LC is a much under-recognized artist, although she has had some success in occasional musical soundtracks. This is by far her best album, released in 1995, just when the 'angry woman' movement spearheaded by Alanis took off...Indeed I purchased this album on the same day as I got Jagged Little Pill. This approaches a demise of a relationship from a much more mature, introspective and less excoriating fashion. The other party actually produced this album, so it was (I think) a positive step towards healing. 

I have described this in the past as pain without self pity, and in this way has much in common with Janis Ian's work of art-Between the Lines. 

The production here is sensitive, lost of acoustic guitar, soft lilting melodies and enough production to carry it through. 

One of the decades best releases, and to this day still holds up
